Entries.default:
Head held high and with a noose cinched around her neck, Aeldys saunters down a long, wobbling plank that overlooks Dunnage. 

Armed guards flank her, but she pays them no mind.

Once the most powerful pirate in the Deadfire, Furrante now stumbles forward - shoved by a guard with a blood-tipped spear. The captain's shoulders are slumped, a rough noose cinched around his neck, as he reluctantly walks a long plank overhanging the roof's edge.
In the streets far below, a crowd has gathered to watch the execution. Some cheer but more shout obscenities, fight, and weep.

She spits in your direction. 

Then with a lazy grin curling her lips, she steps out from the plank.

"Mark my words, captain - I'm going to haunt you for the rest of your days," she taunts Furrante.

Then with a lazy grin curling her lips, she steps out from the plank.
She looks first to Furrante and then to you - ensuring your face is the last she'll ever see.
In the streets of Dunnage far below, a crowd has gathered to witness the execution. A cacophony of jeers and cheers rises as Furrante emerges into view.

Furrante trembles when the plank wobbles beneath his boots, nearly tripping off the side mid-way. He stops before reaching the very end and tosses a last look at Aeldys over his shoulder. 

She's got her chin tipped high, teeth gritted. He'll find no mercy from her.
Aeldys falls. And the rope snaps taut.
The captain plummets, a holler tearing from his lungs. Then the rope runs out of slack, and the sound's cut silent.
At the end of plank, Aeldys turns to face her executioners. Her chest rises as she takes a deep and final breath.

"Suppose this is where we part ways, lovesome. I'll be dreaming of you in the great beyond. Don't shed too many tears for me."

She mimes you a last kiss. Then with a lazy grin curling her lips, she steps out from the plank.
Then he meets your gaze, words fumbling on his lips, but before he can get a proper plea out, the guard stomps hard on the plank, and Furrante is jarred over the edge.

Furrante trembles when the plank wobbles beneath his boots, nearly tripping off the side mid-way. He stops before reaching the very end and tosses a last look at the Consuaglo members over his shoulder. 

The captains stand straight-backed, unbending in their decision.
